reviews.review_msg: heather is awesome! she is makes all the information clear and concise when going through the lecture topics. my favorite TA so far.

Professor Newman is a great teacher. However, he gives so much assignments and dont grade them in time. The TA was also very unresponsible and dont give us scores in time. In addition to the many assignments, he is really cheap in giving grades. Pretty sure its because in the previous years everyone got an A and now he just gives students <70

Newman isn't a bad guy but I found his lectures incredibly boring. To give him some credit, it wasn't his fault that the content of the course was boring, but his way of speaking made it all the worse.

Expected this class to be worse than it was.  That being said, David gives quite a bit of work - term paper, multiple assignments, a group project, midterm, and final.  Know the material and the exams should be fairly easy.  However, I found David's lectures painfully long and boring.  I'm avoiding taking his classes in the future.

I had a really tough TA, otherwise i would have gotten a much higher grade. that being said, his lectures are very informative. it's just the content is really dry and boring. i barely read anything and listened in lecture and got a decent grade comparing to the effort i put into this class.
Very helpful in many aspects. Very passionate and easy to understand as well. Big load of work but it is worth because the class is very interesting. I will take another class with him 100%.

He is very passionate about the subject, though is not the best at instructing. For a 100 level course, I found it difficult to keep up with the standards of the class as he doesn't really define or answer what is expected. Heavy course load in regards to the many many readings. VERY MONOTONE and was just.. no. You've been warned.

Okay so yes, he is a bit dry. The guy reads off of a tablet so give him a break. Here's the amazing thing, he KNOWS what he's talking about, he's ALWAYS there to help and he's not one of those awful profs who trick you in exams - midterms are super easy, my final is tomorrow. Take it with him, you'll learn a lot - just don't fall asleep in class:)

Extremely boring, and at times I thought he was speaking another language when he was muttering. He repeats himself and is extremely unorganized, his slides are terrible and he made us buy a useless inspirational book at the beginning of the term (dont get it just look it up). Lots of reading. Just not a well taught class.

In his lectures he is very monotone which makes it really hard to pay attention, but the biggest issue was his lack of knowledge when it comes to technology. Usually it isn't a big deal, but literally every class there was some issue. One class we actually spent completely in the dark - i'm not kidding it was so dark no one could see there notes.

He has an accent which is hard to understand, and switches his slides very quickly, without getting the students to write everything down. Therefore, I would only recommend this class to someone who it is mandatory for.

I fell asleep often. Felt the course as a whole was a bit dry, with a few interesting lectures. Midterm was quite hard, but fair. Keep up with your readings, it'll save you A LOT of work before the exams. He is a good professor that is very helpful and approachable, so make sure you consult him if you are struggling with anything.

Shoot out to mah boy David Newman. Still doesn't know how to use a projector after years of teaching LOL. Cheesed this class with minimal effort. A bit reading and paper intensive, but TAs are nice. Defs recommend though!

David is amazing prof! I took 2 classes with him and would take more. He is extremely helpful. He will always do the best he can to help if you experience problems with the course or assignments. David always comes prepared and tries to make class interesting and engaging. His class isn't easy A, but come to lectures, ask for help and you're fine!

Dave is a GREAT prof, though at some points can be a little dry he is extremely accommodating and very helpful.  The class breakdown and exams are quite fair and there are plenty of opportunities to get good grades. go to lecture, ask questions and you'll be set. He's also real generous when it comes to marking papers/assignments.
David is really a nice professor with good communication knowledge. The exams are not hard if you are hard working and understand what he talk about in class~

David is definitely passionate about the material, unfortunately he struggles to relay the core information in an organized fashion. He puts together his presentations directly before class and often stumbles over slides unsure of their order or sometimes why they are even there. His lack of organization overshadows his passion for the material.

Dr. Newman sincerely cares for his students and is extremely helpful if you do not understand a concept. The custom courseware was two late, however he made sure that we were able to download the material on Canvas.The course is heavy in reading and the exams are not easy, but the Prof is great!

Excellent prof for an introductory course - brought relevant experience and good insights to the table, not only towards the course material, but towards academic practice in general. Inspired me to move towards communications as a possible major - great prof in general.

I like this professor a lot. CMNS 130 has dreadfully boring course material but he's done quite a good job making his lectures interesting and relevant. He's incredibly knowledgeable and fair in his tests. I would advise you to take notes on EVERYTHING he says and study the reading questions like mad, though.

Compared to CMNS 110, this course's load is way tougher and the readings are not as interesting. I disliked the course as it is really dry and writing-intensive. I just didn't like the way how the course was structured. At times, there were some good readings/lectures.

David is an awesome prof! He is very helpful. The material can get a bit dry but he always attempts to make it fun for the class. He is a hard marker, but if you do what he asks, you will receive a good mark! Overall a good course and a great prof!
Some of the ppl here are TAs for sure...

This class involves a lot of reading and lots of essays, it helps if you have a good TA. Prof. Newman is really nice though and if you do have questions he welcomes them and he is very understanding! would take another class with him again!

So boring, can't understand a word this guy says. Easy class lots of reading and writing but easy. He literally DRONES on and on and on about nothing. Go to tutorials but no lectures he just repeats the textbook and none of the movies are on the exam dont buy th Mass Communication in Canada textbook you NEVER use it. Custom courseware is essential

My experience entering CMNS is amazing tnx to David. Extremely helpful to students who seek it, his understanding & support is unmatched to any previous Profs.  Lectures are rich in interesting, controversial, & enlightening content w/ diverse assignments ensuring to intrigue students. I'll definitely take a course with David in the future.

my experience entering the communications field is a great one, thanks to David. He?s more than accommodating & helpful to students who seek his assistance.  His understanding and support was incomparable to any of my last 13 prof?s.  lectures  are rich in content yet it?s still an intro. course providing background knowledge of the field.  His ove
He is nice and helpful but his final exam seems too difficult and doesn't really reflecting on what he has taught us throughout this course.

One of the worst profs ever, our 2 hour lecture became 3 to watch a film, but we have other classes to attend. Then he says that we should not feel disadvantaged on the final when one of the question choices is about the films. Does not take negative feedback well and has a horrible attitude that suggests he think he's always right, which he's not.

Newman is so helpful and understanding!! He is always willing to give extra help to students who need it. You can tell he is very dedicated to what he's teaching. Only cons are that the lectures always go over time, and there is way too much reading for this course.

I think that a lot of the negative comments here are because half of the people in lectures are on their laptops, not paying attention. I find it very easy to keep up with Newman and he clearly is very interested in what he does. He is approachable and his last assignment was really fun. It's not an easy A, but it's worth the effort!
too much reading...

I believe this prof got a bad rap this round but this was partially due to an inexperienced TA. Newman is kind of old school in his ideas - for a first year class there is a lot more expected readings then any other class I have taken (up to 300level) Otherwise he truly wants you to achieve and will help you to succeed.
You should be interested and the course content if you plan on taking this course. Otherwise, you might complain later if you were looking for an easy credit.
No comment.

Extremely helpful. One of my favorite TA's out of my educational career thus far. Approachable, doesn't degrade me when I ask stupid questions(I'll admit sometimes they were) Gives great advice on conceptualizing ideas
one of my favorite ta's so far and would definitely take another course of his!
David was by far the most knowledgeable and helpful T.A. I've had in any course.  He also seemed genuinely interested in the subject matter. I would recommend him for sure.
An amazing professor and takes the time to respond to questions.

Enda is a super nice guy, however, the lecture material can be pretty dry, but then again, it is an intro course. Wasn't a huge fan of the article analysis, and for the midterm, just know the slides, and final was kind of hard.

This review is based on taking his online class. I know that the TA is in charge of the course mostly, but it would be nice if Enda had left more clear and organized material to work with. Assignments are vague, "helpful" links lead to pages with one sentence. "Modules" just tell you what to read, no other guidance. Just me and the textbook here.

Enda was quite honestly a sweetheart and I loved him as a person, however, this did not save his incredibly dry lectures. Attending them is important though because most of the important information is communicated verbally, and isn't on his slides. Readings are also very long and very boring but they are essential

Enda is a great professor. He can sound pretentious at times, but this was a first-year CMNS class and he usually teaches higher level courses so I'm sure it's not intentional! There's one writing assignment, one midterm, a term paper, and a final. Not too much reading, but don't fall behind. Enda is really funny and explains every concept well.

Personally I find Enda's lectures to be interesting and well organized. His lectures are easy to understand and straight forward. Readings are definitely dry but it's one of those things you just have to get done and over with. There is an article analysis, a midterm, a term paper and a final.
One of the best teachers. Really interesting and well-planned course.

Enda is a great prof. His lectures are very interesting and clear. Readings can be on a dryer side  but all the articles complement lectures very well.  CMNS 130 is an amazing course for everyone because it gives you a deeper knowledge about everything that happens around you. But be ready to work hard and don't fall  far behind the readings.

Enda is a sweetheart. Clear lecturer, super knowledgeable and passionate, brings in a lot of film clips to illustrate his points and brings in guest speakers every so often to bring in real life perspectives. He may lecture slow but he is so clear. Would love to take a class with him again.

He can be monotonous and talks very slow. Wish we could go back and listen to his lectures but they aren't recorded. What ruined it for me was the TA's -they marked this course like a 3rd year course and expectations were unclear. Class has article analysis assignment, midterm, paper, final. Exams were mostly reading based.
nice guy, clear lectures and slides. dont dig the midterm and that term paper tho

He doesn't record the lectures so if you skip one then you'll probably fall behind. He's also sort of monotone so it can get boring specially because this class is more theoretical. It gets sort of interesting if you understand the material but a lot of the readings can get complicated. Not awesome and not awful

Enda was super organized and always went over the last lecture and told us specifically what he expects us to know/ gain from the main topics. There is only a midterm, essay and final. There was a lot of emphasis on getting help if you needed it and Enda always allowed speakers to come in ! :) was interesting if you were into the material

I'm a first year, so it's important for me to have a good professor. Enda is extremely clear, and you can tell he is really passionate about this field. He also answers questions very well, and I don't feel as though I am being left behind at all, even though this is a lecture of 300+ students. I'm now even considering a minor in communications!

Enda is a great teacher, but I just find the workload a bit heavy since I'm a first year & I am terrible at taking notes. He also gives you online pdf versions of the readings & study guide. There is also a paperback if you want it, but otherwise the pdfs are there.
BEST PROF EVER! ENDA WAS SO HELPFUL AND CLEAR I don't see why anyone else would not like his lectures.Best prof I've seen so far.
Do the readings and pay attention, easy class.
Enda is just amazing! I took cmns 130 with him and he made the course really interesting . very helpful and clear lecture and super funny guy.
his lectures are incredibly boring. He can be quite unclear. Slides are useless. Could be the bland course material though.

Enda is an extremely passionate prof but his lectures are hit and miss. There are some days that are really interesting, particularly the days he shows clips of documentaries (which is a lot) but when just going through the power point slides, class tends to drag on. Overall he really cares about his students and the class isn't difficult

Engaging prof, interesting, down-to-earth and clearly cared about the course material. He's funny as well. The course was interesting and I would take another course with him. The only issue I found was that the exams were a bit too difficult - they required analysis of the concepts that was far above what we were given the tools for.

Great prof - helpful, knowledgeable etc. I know some people got upset because they plagiarized and got caught. If you do your own work and make an effort you can get an A. Sometimes he talks too slow but at least he cares about what he's teaching! Loved the class.

he's a great speaker, explains material very clearly. willing to help and nice, funny at times.however you need to attend ALL lectures as his slides aren't that informative. overall he's a good prof, just that the material is extremely boring and dry.
Found his class, and lectures, to be v. interesting. He's stoked on the material, and it shows in his lectures. Also v. approachable.

Before I attended his class, I thought he was a women prof. But not, whatever. He classes were super boring. I remember the class of the semester he taught super fast and said "you wouldn't have to come this semester because I went over all the material in this class" LAME! He tries really hard to be funny, but he isn't.

Brutal.
 worst TA i had...
 if you get her... CHANGE TUTORIALS
 This coming from a 4th year CMNS student

She treats her students like kindergarteners. I got 2.3 out of 15 on an essay. I don't even know where the .3 came from. I had another professor look at the essay and she (an English prof) said it didn't warrent such a grade at all. She was a TA that never attended lecture so she never has any idea what we were learning.

If you have to take CMNS 130, Anis is the best chose. He made me love communication! His lectures are very interesting, he makes jokes, he adapts concept to nowadays and explain course concepts very clear.

She's one of the worst lecturers I've ever had. I fall asleep 10 minutes into the lecture everytime. And this was an late afternoon course too! I should be wide awake at this time, and I normally am. Her redeeming quality is that she is really nice and approachable.
SOooooooo boring, is a good cure for those who can't sleep, everything is so plainly horrible, is so easy to just tune out whatever she says
No Comments
No Comments
BORING! you will fall alseep in this class. ahmad is not a good speaker and it effects the quality of the topic. did not enjoy cmns130 at all.
No Comments
This is a very hard course! Lots of stuff that you need to know, theories especially! But Anne is a very very nice and helpful prof! I like the videos that she shows in lectures! ^^

Bad accents but it's not her major issue. She have a weird political mindset. Strong political view students can't understand her simple logic, weak political view students will influence by her weird values. Her PowerPoint is ok, but her lecture is kind of irrelevant to her PowerPoint. Don't understand why she can teach in fic. Worst course.

Ying-Feng is a lovely, understanding, and flexible teacher. She shows passion and interest in what she teaches. Whether you are interested in communication or not, her content is of broad interest. However, she speaks pretty softly; at first, it can be challenging to understand her because her accent is thick.
She is fantastic as a lecturer. Does not put any unnecessary burden on students. Clear and straightforward about the concepts. She is passionate.

This professor's voice in class is so low that she needs a microphone to help amplify her voice. Even so, it was difficult for me to hear what she said. Her English has an accent that makes it difficult for me to understand her lectures.

I put in all the effort, I spent at least 3 hours a day in the library, and I got almost perfect scores on my multiple choice midterms, but she never gave you top marks on my papers, I don't know why, I attended every class, but my participation grade was only half, please don't pick her
dont pick her
Just don't pick her, if you want to have a perfect college life. You can't understand what she's thinking.
Worst professor ever! I even cant understand her because of her horrible accent. Terrible attitude, unclear feedback. DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS.

Her exam is not hard but you basically have to put much effort to get a good grade since the exams worth 50% overall in the class. My paper has a decent grade and other assignments as well, but not good at exams. 50% IS TOO MUCH!

She is very good at explaining if you're struggling with something. Very understanding! I wish I had taken CMNS110 with her as well. She made CMNS130 seem very interesting and I even enjoyed the readings!Went from C in CMNS110 to A+ in CMNS130:)

Shes not a bad teacher. Her lectures can be kind of confusing at times coz she have a thick accent. Try to ask her about things you dont understand and papers before its due for more feedback. What's hard about her course is the fact that sometimes she asks vague questions that needs specific answers. But all in all not bad
Great Professor and she is a very friendly person!
Very good Prof! She knows exactly what she's talking about!
Terrible
Lecture is too weak and not helpful

Hard to understand because of the pronunciation. Lecture in typical Asia style teaching form. Very not clear grading criteria. Lectures are not inspiring. It seems like it's just copied and pasted from Google and Textbooks.

Too demanding assignments and hard grading but too little clarity with topics and delivery. Listening to her lectures was a very frustrating experience. Unnecessary use of difficult words in addition to pronunciation problems in her English :(

Lost my interest in CMNS after taking this course with her. Her English is often difficult to understand and very monotonous. She gives lot of info in lecture slides to compensate this but it does not inspire to learn more. Nice in person but lacks engagement skills in class. Take this course only if u have no choice.

had a little difficulty with her english but she's actually very knowledgable and ready to explain more. She is very caring and kind. The lectures are interesting and fun yet challenging. You need to put your effort if you want an A.

My inspiration to learn communication ended after I took CMNS130 -Ying-Fen' knowledge of English leaves much to be desired - Reading as homework is not always related to class topics. +She has many office hours and she is ready to help -not easy to get A / A+ because her test questions are not fully clarified.
Lecture is good but it's hard to obtain high grades
gr8

I agree that she seems to be in love with the sound of her voice. She's really really enthusiastic about mass communication, but wasn't really helpful in making us more interested. Lectures were sometimes entertaining though... she's a dramatic and intense speaker lol.

Her lectures are long and go on forever.  The topics she discusses are interesting, but sometimes takes too much time to dwell on it.  She gives a lot of readings and missing one, two or ten of her lectures is okay, just as long as you go to tutorial
Lets just say the lectures start and then she gets on this never ending roll which u dont understand....i wudnt say the class was hard...but i wud have done better if i knew wht she was talking abt

Ok, I took this class 2 years ago, but I've been in University for 5 years now and she is by far the worst professor I have ever had. In support of some positive comments that have been made, I never visited her office hours so she may be helpful outside of lecture, but MY LORD not everyone loves your voice as much as you, only say what's important
Awesome prof!
No Comments

this class was so boring and so painful
 i didn't learn anything but did surprisingly well

I did well in the class but it was no thanks to Catherine or the TA's.  Her lectures could not have possibly been more boring.  I listened to her double speed at home and it still wouldn't go fast enough. Not a good experience for me.

Face it, guys: CMNS 130 is not easy.  It's not necessarily that Catherine has vague assignments or that she doesn't know how to teach.  Everyone complains about 130, regardless of the prof.  Either way, she's a pretty decent professor in my books, and definitely a powerhouse of knowledge.
GOSH!! She is the catalyst of putting ppl to sleep. TAs are not very helpful at all.

Catherine is in love with her own voice, so lectures become extremely irritating to go to.  However, beside the fact that her TAs are a little slow and narrow-minded, she is extremely helpful and will listen to anyone who approaches her to ask a question.

This class is designed to weed out the weak. Don't take it if you want to sample cmns because it's not an accurate representation. On top of her poor teaching abilities, she is stuck with level 1 TAs that usually are hopelessly useless
This was my first course in communications and Murry completely turned me off of it. The lectures are hard to follow and put you to sleep and she excepts way too much from first years students.

Passionate and extremely enthusiastic.  Yes, the course is not *easy* (although very interesting), but that's the point of CMNS 130.  I took it last fall and it definitely helped me in my later CMNS classes, especially because of the challenges Catherine made me put up with.

God....this class is really boring...and Catherine really does talk like she's in love with her own voice.  The assignments are hard.  She makes this class into a writing based course so writing plays a big part in this class.  Alse, her lecture notes are way too much and she talks really fast too!
Very hard course, primarily because there is confusion for how to do every single assignment. The class is so boring that i attended once, then i gave up and stop going.
anyone know should we study more on the articles or the notes? cuz the notes are way to much

Let me put it this way: At the beginning of the semester, the classroom was completely full and some people had to sit on the stairs.  By the end of the semester, you can put your feet on the seat in front of you and put your books on the seats beside you.

A difficult course. Hard to understand lectures and the concepts she talks about because she makes things too complicated for people who haven't had any communications background before. So it's hard to stay awake. Lots of writing assignments and readings as well.

She is soooooo BORING! Many people just leave her class half way because of that. And there are many assignments to do in her class. If you want to take CMNS 130, I would recommand you take it with another professor.
Imagine the voice of Janice on "Friends". Now, imagine the voice of two Janice's put together. Now, imagine the voice of Murray.

WELL, lets see.. her lectures have nothing to do with her lecture notes, her lecture notes have nothing to do with the book..she talks about USELESS material.i don't know what to study for the final..i'm gonna cry..ahha

Terrible prof, course content is really interesting but she lectures like she likes the sound of her own voice, which by the way is really naslely and hard to listen to.  We've had guest lecturers who were great but she'd interrupt at weird times to say weird things just so her voice could be heard
I think she's brilliant! It's impossible to write down everything she cover sin lecture but all the same its interesting stuff.
notes are all over the place
aw...well i feel bad for her...she tries...she knows her stuff....go catherine...just..talk slower for gods sake...and do better notes..cmon...who needs 200 slides a lecture

slept through the lectures. wish i never took it, but i have the "non-quitter" approach to life. everything is marked super hard. so if u have a choice, go for 110...stear clear of 130. she's super booooring
after 3 lectures, i dropped out. it ended up being a class on politics, not communications.  i didn't learn anything new except that "communications goes way back..." wasted my time
A hard marker on essays, lecutres are boring and she's too full of herself for me to respect her opinions. Not recommended at all.
Lectures were totally crappy. Didn't show up. She marked kinda hard too.
Boring lectures that leaves you wondering if you learn anything. REadings are boring as well and she's way too passion about wut she teaches that it seems like she's helding a lecture for herself
she likes to string together long sentences.. and leave a gap in the middle while she thinks of more long words to add to the string.  pretty boring, hard to follow, etc.
Extremely boring lectures.  I can honestly say that this is the only university class that I have taken where I did not learn a single thing.  A waste of time.
Nice lady, but she is a terrible lecturer...very opinionated and kind of grew on me that way...it's amazingly ironic that what she teaches is Communications because she's not a great communicator.

She's not as bad of a lecturer as is noted below, but she is in love with herself, and this shows. She's not very inspiring, helpful, and is completely biased in a very offending way. Her class marks seem to reflect a popularity contest.

I applaud for the online notes she put up there... because with the way she's teaching the class... no wonder the class size shrinks to about 1/3 of when the semester started.... she's HORRIBLE in lecturing.... and just goes supporting her own biases. BAD
I distinctly dislike her lectures.  Her notes are both confusing and long.  She does not elaborate on the notes she puts up either.
Horrible teacher. Not worth going to classes. THANK GODDE FOR ONLINE NOTES!

Her lectures are too redundant. She repeats the same points over and over, and then starts up another point, the repeats the previous point over again. Her lectures are far too scattered. Students would ask her to turn back pages because she isn't precise

Awesome.  But because she knows so much about what she teaches and is so into it, she has a tendancy to talk a lot about it and forget that some of the studnents doesn't have her depth of knowledge.  Enthusiastic and always cool about helping her students
the worst teacher i've ever had. all she does is talk and talk and talk... very confusing and all over the place. students never know what information is important or irrelevant.

I had her class the morning of Sept 11. And Catherine lectured the most passionate lecture I've seen in university... She's so personable! I'm not even a Cmns student but I did very well in her class and enjoyed it thoroughly.
Lectures too much about politics Capital P.... geez... and too much information for a first yr course....
No Comments
l/notes are the #1. u can ignore the text if no time.
stuff was dry....but she seems to enjoy every single of lecture~enthusiastic~
No Comments
overaught, condecending, just preaches feminism and politics
very passionate lecturer,
A very clear and engaging lecturer

i found his tutorial very useless, and all the things he said does not relate to the lecture, plus i dont know why ppl think he is useful, well, he was easy to our presentation, but he was pretty strict on our essays
I was really nervous in my first year and Clayton made the tutorial discussions so relaxed. He was very helpful with my writing. Overall a good experience.

He was my TA for one of my first post-secondary classes which was not helpful at all.  He seems like a nice guy at first, but when you go and ask him to clarify something, he goes on a completely different tangent only becoming really degrading. NOT recommended.
Coming right out of highschool this TA, in my opinion, wasn't very good. His complicated answers did little to help in this course.

Rod is really the best instructor you can find at SFU. He really tries hard in making sure that everything he introduced is understood by students. Also super accessible after class and encourages questions. Make sure to take his class when you have a chance!
One of the best professors I have ever had!
Makes lecture videos so entertaining and the way he teaches makes things easier to understand
I missed my first midterm due to miscalculating the timezone difference but Rod was amazing and so understanding! This class was so much fun, honestly my favourite class that I have taken.

One of the best professors at SFU, super caring, and understanding. He is one of the most passionate professors I have ever had, who takes time to answer students' inquiries and apply everyday life situations to theories in class. He would check up on my mental health and ensure I was alright. Please enroll in his course if you get the chance.
One of the best professors whose classes I have attended! Very understanding and kind. Learnt a lot from his class.
she AWESOME, very nice women, easy marking. I would take another class with her

Arthur sparked my interest in media convergence here in Canada. No prof to date has spent the amount after class going over papers.  Arthur goes WAY beyond ANY professor I have ever had.  He is a wonderful person who has his OWN mind which at times may defy course content and the typical characteristics of a TA or prof.
not super helpful or interesting  but he was TAing, what's a man to do?

This prof seemed like he did not know what he was doing and all of the tutorial teachers marked so hard. The lectures were so hard to follow and he doesn't record anything. After class there would be a huge line up behind him of confused and annoyed students who needed answers because he confused the whole class and the tests were so hard

Great person. Great prof. Passionate and kind. Exam-based course but if you pay attention and memorize the concepts the essay questions come as a breeze. Darren wants to hear where he can get better too. It is amazing how Darren wants to learn from his students but is also such a source of knowledge. Personable Prof too; knew my name immediately.

Professor fleet was very accommodating and kind. readings were long and often boring, but standard for university level. lectures were boring at times but he tried his best to keep us focused and attentive. overall, nice professor but hard course

I disagree with the person who rated  him yesterday. Professor Fleet's classes are highly insightful, and though they are extremely detailed lectures, you really only need to focus on the big ideas for this class. He gives a lot of real-life examples on concepts, and encourages his students to be critical thinkers by exploring different narratives.
Roman is very flexible and considerate of the students' needs. The written assignment is a strange and interesting intro to communications studies.

Roman does remind ppl of that father in "My Big Fat Greek Wedding" -- friendly and hilarious. Above all soooo knowledgeable! Yeah i agree that u either enjoy or dislike his way of teaching. He's teaching from his crisp CMNS experience, not the d
Roman is a hilarious, great lecturer. Really reasonable, zesty and interesting.  He reminds me of a really happy pirate.  Interesting approach to communications, flexible term paper. no final!
Best prof ever!Stand on students' side..

Great Prof! She tends to give away some exam/midterm questions for those that actually show up to lectures!! She mutes the microphone so people that skip can't listen her hints on the audio recording. DON'T SKIP!

Amazing prof, amazing person. Has a real passion for the course and the material. Extremely helpful with class material and wants students to succeed in her class as well as in their individual lives. Convinced me to pursue communications as a field of study. Favourite class & prof so far. Exams are fair, marking is fair, TA (Heather) was great.
wonderful lady. Don't hesitate to see her if you have any questions. she is extremely helpful and patient!

Shes an amazing prof! Her tests are fair and the TAs marking is really generous. Listen to the lecture recordings for the midterm and study the readings for the final. I got so much out of this class, take it!
The class is not hard, but you have to catch up the reading every week. My TA is really easy and helpful. Overall, I like this class
Lectures are rather dry. She makes it very clear what material will be on the exam, but they are hard nevertheless. TAs mark fairly.

You have to go to class.  The lectures are dry but interesting.  Do the readings.  Her exams are really difficult but both her and her TAs mark fairly.  Its an interesting class that I really enjoyed.

She is a good prof and she is very clear in her powerpoint slides, however, the readings require very high concentration as they can be somewhat dry. This is quite a hard course and readings are very important for the final.

Boring class-you do not need to be there to learn- just listen to lecture recording with slides- this teach you everything you need to know. Her TA salama ayyad- very hard marker, and very serious! Watch out!
she knows what she's talking about and what she's doing.

DO NOT THAKE HER CLASS IF YOU ARE NOT CMNS MAJOR. seems like lots of people liked her, but I did not find this class interesting at all. it was all about dry and hard theories around policy and regulations. So boring. a lot of writing, TA marks hard.  Too bad she is the only one who is teaching this course. and too bad it is a requirement for cmns.

I hate the policy and regulation stuff so I thought it was a pretty hard class. My TA marked pretty harshly, which was another bad thing. I wish I took this class with another prof. Prof's voice can be monotone and boring. She likes to go in detail for the pp notes so it's better to attend lecture. Not a W course, but quite a lot of writing.

Kathi is a great prof. She makes lectures very interesting and easy to understand. Unfortunately, not all of her TAs are helpful tho. Lucky Kathi is very motherly and reminds you in lecture of important course details!

me and most of the classmates that i have talked to, all hated the theory,policy,and regulation stuff thats filled in this course. ............Did not really make sense,and feel like the TA didnt really have anything to say, and was quite dry. I wish this was not a requirement course. TA marks REALLY HARD.

Don't take distance education because you have to get 50% on the final in order to pass. If you don't get it, you must be fail!!! Final exame is hard, and it has 8 short essay questions. To pass this course, you need to review all chapters from the textbook. I think school should be change the worth of final 35% to 50% to get attention.
Really nice prof, interesting and up to date with global events. Highly recommend Kathleen
Smart, helpful, funny and very engaged.
useless power points. final was hard. shes nice and knows wat shes doing but i think not so great for first years. and way too many textbooks and useless assignments

A very funny and knowledgeable prof. Lectures can be a bit of a drag, but the material itself was interesting and applicable to everyday life. This class made me want to pursue a further degree in Communications.
Great prof! Very funny, knowledgable and passionate. Also gave great feedback regarding assignments and encouraged class participation. Would definitely look for her as a prof in the future.

I was a little frustrated with this class (Fall 24). There was two midterms, final exam and 400-word weekly assignments.The course was all over the place and there were no rubrics so you didn't know what was expected and it took a long time to get back marks. The TA's were harsh with their marking. I learnt a lot though!

no one should be uploading 3, 3hour online recorded video lectures where the talking speed is slow, as well as 2, 20-40 page readings a week. there is a quiz each week 4 multiple choice answers worth 0.25 each. and then one written response worth 1point. instructions unclear, not to mention they want an essay format with citations for this "quiz"

Worst prof ever, unorganized and unstructured. The lectures were horrible and she does not know how to teach. The weekly quizzes consist of about 3-4 multiple choice questions and a 300-400 word essay answer - no rubric or criteria and the essay answer was about 90% of the grade. She is hard to understand and not helpful. DO NOT TAKE

Horrible. Her voice puts me to sleep and is so hard to hear that I need to connect my laptop to an external speaker and run it at full volume just to hear what she's saying. In addition to terrible lectures, her quizzes are unfair.2 points for an essay question where the TA can drop your grade by an entire mark for no reason since there's no rubric

Recorded lectures were extremely difficult to understand, had to re-watch some parts repeatedly. For a first year course, the prof assigns very difficult, long-winded readings. Exams took 3+ hours as a lot is asked of the students. Prof is transparent on content. Exams asked for 3 sources on some definitions despite only mentioned from one source.

she has a lot of bad reviews, but it really depends on your TA. some mark fairly well, while others would rather die than give full marks. overall pretty straightforward, the exam essays and reading reflections are so tedious though. paraphrase your citations more often than direct citing and listen to feedback (if your TA even gives you any).

The "quizzes" and I use quotations because the quizzes in length and effort were more like midterms. Speaking of midterms there's two of them. Her exams/quizzes consists of "short" answer questions that require a 300 word count per answer plus sources. Absolutely ridiculous. She's probably a nice lady but an awful professor.

By far the worst class I have taken in university with the worst professor I have ever been "taught" by. Long & boring lecture videos, nonsensical grading system, ridiculous amounts of work for small percentages of grade. Word count is too small for me to hit every point about why she is awful. If you must do this course, Do it with someone else
do not take this class if not mandatory.

Probably the worst communication and layout I've ever had for a class. Terrible format on canvas and she's crammed a paper, a full module, and a quiz all within the last 3 days of the course. No clear rubrics, harsh marking and never responds to emails.

Honestly the worst cmns class ive ever taken. grading was terrible as the quizes take forever to complete but are only worth 3 marks...  questions are compare and contrast but are worth 0.25 points. the only good thing about the quizzes is that they are open for a whole week with no time limit. I'd advise you not to take this course unless needed!!
not worth the stress

Both the prof and TA dodge you and expect you to figure it out on your own, don't have clear marking rubrics, and will nitpick things even if you did them (ex. 400 word limit and you go over or under by 10 words not even %).Bad experience and this is coming from a 3rd year taking this course... can't imagine being a 1st yr trying to get though this

This professor can only be explained as awful and atrocious. The TA specifically assigned to some in the class barely replies, sometimes they don't answer at all and this can be said for Svitlana as well. The marking is awful, the class is not friendly to those who need assistance or are neurodivergent. Steer clear, skip her or take w someone else.

Svitlana is a terrible professor. For a 100 level course, she / the TAs are insanely hard markers and take forever to return even tiny assignments. The exams are only 3 questions but she gives 3 potential questions for each and chooses one to be on the exam. So, for prep you'll probably write the equivalent of 7-9 essays in ONE WEEK.

There are 3 quizzes, each with 10 questions, all of which take 2 hours to complete. Mind you, these are only worth 2% of our grade. The grading scheme is very poorly thought out and executed. Do not take this course unless you have to. Good luck!

She's unclear with her works, she barely replies to students and her first quiz, made us write about 100 words for definitions (0.25 mark x 8) + 2 MCQ. (3 marks for 10 questions.) she got complained by 50+ students. I would NOT recommend to take.

Svitlana is not that great of a prof. Her voice can be very monotonous, making it hard to watch the lectures online. The midterms and final were generally easy as long as you had a good TA, which I didn't have. Basically, just don't take a class with her unless you understand the content really well because her exams are quite straightforward

OMG, worst prof I've ever had. Assigns ridiculously high-level readings for a 100-level course and doesn't explain it at all in class. If your TA doesn't know what's going on, neither will you. Extremely boring lectures that just make things more confusing. Only good part: very straightforward exams, easy to ace if you prepare.

I appreciated Svitlanas transparency with exam and course structures. Not once was I confused about what was happening in the course. However, I barely learned much from her lectures. She does a poor job of explaining concepts beyond what is shown on the powerpoint slides. Thankfully my TA was awesome so I was able to do alright in CMNS 130.

In order to do well in this class you need to attend tutorials and pay attention. My TA was great and thanks to her I did well on the exams. Material is boring and lectures are unorganized only way to stay organized is by Tutorials. Lots of long, dense and difficult readings, majority of them are useless to read don't fall behind and you'll do well

I'm sorry but if you don't need this course as a pre-req for something else I'd say DO NOT take it. Incredibly boring and off-topic lectures, LOTS of dense readings that never connect, unorganized course materials, etc. Prof is nice and you can tell she's passionate, she's just not good at engaging the class or explaining the course material.
Very boring voice that puts me to sleep tbh. However the organization and use of material to keep you engaged is flawless.

Covers a list of important terms at the beginning of each class yet often fails to define all of them meaning that you'll have to find them yourself. Slides are fairly useless so you're forced to go to lectures which are difficult to pay attention to given how dry she is. Luckily the content is pretty simple or else this class would be impossible

I had many problems with this prof. She was very unclear in her lectures, often giving multiple definitions of terms and not specifying which one she wanted in the papers/final. This class had an unnecessary amount of papers to write, and I personally had a HORRIBLE TA. Would not recommend taking this course with her, it made me hate this subject!

She's really passionate but she somehow manages to still be boring. Her lectures are long and her slides aren't very helpful so you have to listen closely. The class wasn't hard though and if you do your readings you'll be fine.

HORRIBLE. HORRIBLE. Currently taking this class right now- beware!!! The structure of the lectures is non existent. Most of the time no one knows what the hell she is talking about... People don't pay attention in class because it is sooooo dry and boring. BEWARE! OUR MIDTERM IS TODAY AND SOUNDS HARD.

Very nice prof; she spends time going over the readings in class. Few slides, mainly talks ... material is quite boring and her delivery is not that exciting. Usually spends 10-15 minutes per slide, though there are times where it was more 30 mins. Final and Midterm were pretty straightforward, but the course was only marked by a few things.

Her lectures are quite detailed but get drawn out and boring after she goes on about 1 point on her slide for a solid 15 minutes. Personally, I don't find her accent that distracting but I never really paid attention to the lectures after week 4. There's a textbook but I never read any of the readings. Quizzes and paper were straight forward to do
didn't use the textbook whatsoever and the lectures were horrible, made 0 sense 90 percent of the time, unnecessarily complicated explanations for material that could've been very interesting

So much potential for this class to be amazing considering the course material, but unfortunately that's not always the case. Svitlana was very enthusiastic but her lectures were nonsensical. Many useless slides and tangents. She is so quiet and my TA was a mess too. You'll get an A if you do include readings in your essays and exams - that's all

Ms. Patterson ( I do not refer to her as Doctor because she doesn't deserve that credential) has changed my view of university as a whole. As a marker, she's tough, and gives awful feedback (even when requested). As a teacher, she reads off papers and discourages questions. As an academic her work is sloppy at best. Worst prof at SFU.

Not the best TA. her marking is extremely hard, especially for a first year university course. She doesn't seem to be clear when explaining assignments/ presentations. Avoid unless you want your GPA to drop.

She is the worst TA I ever had. Doesn't help you with anything, and if she does, it's very vague. Her markings are ridiculously hard and you cannot question her about them. She makes no effort in explaining or discussing questions you may have and treats you poorly. How this woman is a PhD student, I don't know.

Horrible Horrible TA. She wants you to fail on the course and she has very weird personality. She doesn't seem she's interested in teaching and she's always complaining her low wage as a TA. All I can say to you is.. Avoid, Avoid her.

I thought Byron is a good professor, he gets a lot of hate but I also think that could just be cause of the course itself as it is a little dense. His lecture videos can be very long and can drag on, but he tries to make them fun and engaging by saying funny things.
Don't even know where to start. Only took this class because it was online and there wasn't a final exam. Run if you can.
Run

Needed this course for my major otherwise i would have dropped it after the 1st lecture. his lectures are long and confusing, the readings and subjects are that of upper level courses and little guidance is given for the midterms and assignments. 

he is funny though and includes memes on his slides which made me laugh (why 2/5 and not 1/5)
This guy uploads 2 hour lectures and then doesn't spend 15 minutes on mandatory readings, Spends at least an hour just yapping

Weekly journals and lots of readings which were provided. He explains the readings a bit in the lectures but you would still need to check the readings anyways since he sometimes won't when he could have just done so. He definitely likes yap a lot in the lectures (I think he admits to this himself).

Byron gave little feedback on work and his video lectures would drag on and on. Byron also doesn't give very clear instructions. A lot of unnecessary bits in the video lectures that made it difficult to get through all of them in one day. Too many complicated long course readings. Final assignment did not make sense.

More often than not the professor as well as the TAs would give little to no valueable feedback on harshly assigned work. No tutorials in this course contributed to the severe lacking of guidance and assistance in this course. Absolutely would not take again.

lectures dragged on & included information not relevant to exams or assignments. Weekly readings were long and confusing, but you need to have knowledge of each in order to do well on the exams. Content is quite boring, would not recommend it unless you're a CMNS major. Dr Hauk was very nice & helpful though, especially throughout the TA strike.

Ill be completely honest even though I received an okay grade in this class it was way more trouble than it was worth. Essentially he rambles on throughout his lectures and leaves you with your time wasted and a bunch of BS notes that won't even show up on any of the examinations. Just focus on the readings nothing else, not the best prof imo.

No assignments just graded by tests/exams. Did not read off the slides so make sure to listen carefully and take good notes. There are LOTS of difficult readings in this class. However, the tutorial was not helpful at all as we were given extra readings and did not focus on what we were taught in the lecture.

Byron is really passionate about his work and makes his lectures as engaging as possible. Super nice and understands the large amount of workload for students, so he makes the exams as easy as possible. There were quite a few readings (averaging 30-40 pages each week) that you'll need to read if you want a good mark. Overall a great prof!
His lectures are useless. since cmns 130 is a writing course. You'll be fine as long as you do okay on those essays.
He is totally off topic. Makes irrelevant topics during class. I totally lost interested in the course because of his lack of enthusiasm

This was the worst communications class i had ever taken. Ian is a nice guy, but the most interesting part of the lecture is seeing which crazy sweater he will wear next. He tends to ramble and get sidetracked with stories that bear no relevance very easily. The course is not hard, just be sure to attend tutorials and complete all assignments.
Boring no point of going to lectures nothing of them on exams!

He wore the same sweater to almost every class! It was blue and looked like it had dolphins on it, maybe. I took this in Fall 07 adn the slides had so many notes on them but they were pretty much useless. After the first few weeks of class, half the class never showed up until the last day before the final. But we got to watch movie clips, which wa

He honestly means well and I liked him as a person but as a prof... he was bland and his jokes seemed rehearsed...and very proffessor-humor-ish. And if that is the worst I can say about him then he must not be THAT bad... right? Also in his defense... he has the most boring Communications class to teach. really.

Lectures boring, vague, random, overcomplicates the most simple things. There were no key points or main ideas to the class- told us to only take notes on what we found 'interesting', so no clue what we will be tested on. For the amount of money we pay and work we put into his (useless) assignments students deserve much better than this.
Never again. Boring and unclear. Very specific when it comes to assignments. Has a passion for communications but cannot teach.
HE IS THE BEST PROF EVER! His jokes are hilarious and the content is very interesting!!!
Course materials are less organized.

worst prof ever. boring as hell, do not sit down in his lecture without a DS or laptop. totally agree that he overcomplicates things and his lectures don't help at all. his TA's are the worst ever. mine barely speaks english - not to be **** - but come on. Nice sweaters, Cosby.

I totally disgree he is helpful when you need something, he never reply emails after the semester finished. Imagine if he is a customer service representative; the company will be closed within 3 days.

Nice guy, but boring lectures.  They are totally off topic, and he really makes the material sound like rocket science.  I never came out of his lectures with any good notes.  He's helpful when you need something.

So boring, wears the same sweater every lecture. Laughs at his own jokes which aren't funny. He makes communication sound like a science, and has the most complicated definitions for everything, i could've summed up what he said in like 2 words. make sure you attend tutorials because you will have no idea whats going on in lecture

I must admit that he is talented. He can make the most interesting topic dull. He never sticks to the outline and tells us about too many other books to read "for fun". I reccommend taking a computer to class, then you can actaully get work done. I use the time to do other homework. I feel bad for his TA's.

This is not a hard course. Ian however makes it into something way more complicated than it needs to be, and i find him a little eccentric. DO NOT take Carolyn for your T.A, she is mean and an unfair marker, with no real clear marking scheme.

I went to class just to watch him laugh at his own jokes. He's a very good TA, but a very hard marker...as long as you do EXACTLY what is on the assignments, you will get a good grade. Be warned, your hand can and WILL fall off after each lecture. He's a sweet guy & knows a lot about what he's teaching and his final was fair. Do your hmwrk!

I enjoy Ian's lectures and find his comments to the films amusing. Lots of interesting material to read. However, the T.A. is mean and unapproachable. Is this a 1st year course or a 3rd year? T.A. is demeaning to students and intimidating. Because of her I do not enjoy this course and find it more challenging. I am not the 1st to say this either!

This class is helpful (for future cmns classes) and interesting but take it with another prof - higher marks guaranteed. As well, switch tutorials if you had Carolyn Liu as your TA, she's mean and brutal, not just her marking, her personality too!
Professor Chunn can be very confusing at times, going on tangents about literature and other topics. He seems like a nice guy though.

Unclear, rambles on and on, can't stand listening to this guy's lectures, something about him that is so nerdy that makes me want to give him a wedgie. TA was Carolyn Liu(Lui?), horrible TA, brutal in her marking
Chunn is seriously dull, despite his good intentions.  I found it nearly impossible to pay attention to him for more than about a minute.  His final exam is heinous.
Lectures were unfocussed.

While there is no doubt that Professor Chunn is a really knowlegeable and passionate instructor, his lectures were somewhat disorganized, the marking of the essays and written assignments were beyond ridiculous, and students paid more attention to his sweater than to his course notes! MAJOR improvements need to be made!
totally agree with it, kinda just keep talking. But good scale for the course outline, which final is worth for 25% and no midterms

Oh man what a bad prof.  This guy just keep talking and talking, you can't tell what's important.  He just keeps putting up notes on the overhead and getting off topic.  He talks almost like he's stoned when he lectures.

His lectures are pretty interesting. He definitely knows his stuff. He's very into it, too. He encourages discussions (since we were in harbour center). Lots of writing, but..what do you expect in communications class?!

SAME COMMENT: "Likes to "sprint" through material, claims nothing is important, says oh you already know this...so rushes through it. Lots of info not enough time, doesnt bother to emphasize important points, so if you want to bother, you basically have to review the lecture tapes or have a really good TA. Pretty useless" CAN'T BE STRESSED ENOUGH

He is not as bad as people say. Most of the lengthy lecture powerpoints is for your own knowledge and use (which is a good thing) and you only need to spend time studying a small proportion (which is made clear). Basic generic introductory stuff. I barely did any readings or work and got an A-.
The prof is terrible and to top if off he talks so quite. His lectures are boring and hard to understand. A teacher lecturing about interesting material should be an interesting person.

The boriest class ever!!! He talks exactly the same in EVERY LECTURE ...like a tape recorder. Bascially, if u have HELEN as ur TA..u dont even need to attend lectures ...Overall, DONT TAKE THIS COURSE UNLESS YOU REALLY NEED IT ...IF YOU REALLY DO..TAKE IT W/ SOME OTHER PROF.

Literally the worst course ever. Prof is unclear in his lectures and boring at the same time. Lectures are all over the place and having them be 2 hours long is even worse. Avoid this course at all cost
The worse class I ever had, Geeze

Great prof, I think the reason he has been getting horrible ratings is that he likes to discuss many things in lecture and a lot of first years who take it don't understand how to process that. I'd suggest stop taking notes and just LISTEN. This man has many great things to say; always trying teach his students something about LIFE.

Likes to "sprint" through material, claims that nothing is important, say oh you already know this...so rushes through it. Lots of info not enough time, doesnt bother to emphasize important points, so if you want to bother, you basically have to review the lecture tapes or have a really good TA. Pretty useless
semi-interesting class, super hard
worst teacher i have ever had
Lectures were BORING! Readings were almost unbearable. Iann seems like a nice enough guy, but he's pretty clueless when it comes to keeping a classes attention.
boring, can't keep class's attention, poor visuals
He seems like a really nice guy. However, his lectures are beyond boring and rather pointless.
The lecture is soooo boring. but my TA is quite nice and helpful. I wish my TA had taught the lecture instead of the prof.
no comment

I'm sure he means well, but his lectures were pretty much pointless. As I flipped through the lecture notes at the end of the semester (before throwing them out), they made more sense, but they're pretty much a waste of paper right 'til the end. Meera Nair is a great TA and is the only reason I passed this course (or even bothered staying at all).

Ian was so boring that by 3 weeks into the semester there was 1/10th the class he started with. The TA was funny with his accent but we never actually learned anythign about communications or writing as this is apparently a writing intensive course. I dont suggest it.

Lectures were very scattered and unrelative to course material. Basically, they were pointless, and half the time a quarter of the class would leave in the middle of the lecture. TA's were very inexperienced and not helpful at all. It just really seemed like he didn't know what he was doing. Would not recommend this course.
Unhelpful.

Sometimes I wondered where he was going with his lecture and I couldn't see the forest through the trees, but after going over the notes, it all made sense.  It was very enlightening and useful for everyday living. My T.A. was wonderful :).
Seems like a nice guy but I didn't know what he was talking about half of the time in lectures.  Kinda scattered.  Lots of written work in this class.

Ian seems like a good prof, however he has little to do with your grade.  The TA was useless.. All he did was tell stories and use out of context analogies in explaining.  Why do i pay over $500 a class to learn out of a $100 course wear book?
Very enthusiastic about course material, Very knowledgable, Lectures a little funky
BORING.  VERY BORING.
Ian is very passionate in this field of study and he takes great notes for you. however, he is very boring as a lecturer.
Very boring. Lectures are scattered and vague. His TA's are useless.  And he assigns a lot of reading, most of which is repeptitive.
Wasnt that accessible, however she posts all her lectures on canvas. Could be more clear with readings. Overall a fairly nice professor

jody gets side tracked a lot of the time, however he is a really nice prof and really cares for communications. tutorials were key to understanding the material. if you skip a class or don't do the reading, you might have trouble understanding the material.
Amazing lectures, but talks really fast.

midterm and finals were open book, they were fairly easy IF YOU DID THE READINGS/ATTENDED CLASS (they consisted of short answer and essay questions). jodys funny, and his lectures weren't boring. I'd recommend him, sure

The kind of professor that makes university seem useless. Extremely repetitive, fails to engage students, talks off topic regularly. Don't expect to receive grades/feedback on your work for a very long time. Spends half the class saying he doesn't like to talk about Trump and spends the other half talking about Trump. Bubbly and kind of annoying.

I am a 4th year student and I can confidently say Jody is the best professor I have had yet. Most people are right when they say professors don't care about you; but Jody truly wants you to succeed and will do anything in power to cultivate that. He's also hilarious so you won't find yourself bored to tears.

I really enjoyed Jody as a lecturer, although sometimes he speeds through the material a little too quickly. Otherwise, his lectures are fun, funny, and engaging. I also didn't find the workload to be too strenuous. Awesome class!

Jody's amazing and he really cares about what he teaches and who he teaches! It was his first time teaching 130 so it got a little confusing, but he's really approachable and encourages students to come in for office hours. He was super flexible and empathetic with deadlines and the midterm/final which were both online too. 100% recommend!

I found his lectures extremely confusing. He seems to go off on many tangents that often seem irrelevant to the course. Speaks very fast and often hard to understand.  I left lectures feeling more confused than informed. Lecture slides were unclear. Overall, confused me I found that I had to do most of my learning from reading textbook.
Examples and comments on our discussions help clarify some key concepts.
awesome TA for CMNS130! Very nice and helpful, just don't be afraid to ask~
